snippet: Edith Windsor and her spouse, Thea Spyer, were together more than 40 years and shared everything, even property, which was heavily taxed as an inheritance after Ms. Spyer died.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on Edith Windsor and her spouse, Thea Spyer; Windsor has paid more than $500,000 in inheritance taxes because her spouse was a woman, a situation Windsor has been fighting in court; federal judge in Manhattan rules in her case that the Defense of Marriage Act was unconstitutional.
